newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Seagate estimate cut.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Seagate estimate cut.

text.p: Salomon Brothers said analysts John Dean and Michele Rothacher lowered their fiscal fourth quarter earnings per share estimate on disc-drive maker Seagate Technology Inc to $1.02 from $1.12, and cut their fiscal year 1997 view to $3.40 from $3.50.
-- said they expect a "more competitive environment" in the distribution channel, primarily at the high-end, leading to more aggressive pricing.
-- "For Seagate, which is solidly positioned in the high-end market, the activity has been slightly more impactive than we had previously forecast," a Salomon report said.

-- said Seagate management views the $1.12 per share fiscal fourth quarter consensus estimate, and Salomon's prior forecast, as "a bit tougher target" and "has conveyed that it is more comfortable with analyst estimates at or around the $1.02 level."
-- The stock was off two points at 40-3/8.
